ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the spanish language and culture
My Spanish speaking, writing, and reading skills improved. I also learned more about Hispanic culture.
Developed use of the subjunctive and more complicated Spanish tenses
I learned the foundational verb tenses in Spanish and did a thorough review of basic grammatical structures. The class included a lot of speaking practice.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course improves Spanish skills as it should, but in class activities were much less fun and engaging than those in L2.
Speaking with partners is certainly a strength. The class should encourage more open ended conversation though, and make sure that people switch partners sometimes.

The class was very organized and structure. I felt that it was an adequate intermediate class, and I felt that my Spanish improved. The grading was a little nitpicky, particularly for the redacciones (as in we would get points taken off for using a pronoun when the professor thought that the pronoun was optional). The class could have been improved with more opportunities for free-form discussion, rather than a q/a, structured practice.
Great pacing, and review of L2.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: L3 Spanish will improve your Spanish skills, just don't expect it to be a very engaging course.
Definitely take it. It wasn't my favorite Spanish class that I've taken at Yale, but it got the job done.
